Definition: We would like you to classify each of the following sets of argument pairs (discussing Gun Control)  into either SIMILAR or NOT SIMILAR. A pair of arguments is considered SIMILAR if the arguments are about the same FACET (making the same argument), and is considered NOT SIMILAR if they do not have the same FACET. A FACET is a low level issue that often reoccurs in many arguments in support of the author's stance or in attacking the other author's position.

Positive Examples.input:
Sent1: Ian brought up the point that guns make you more likely to kill a person. 
 Sent2: You can't be a man unless you're swinging a gun, and no matter how many guns you buy, it's still missing for you .
Positive Examples.explanation: The first argument supports gun control by saying possessing guns make people likely to kill, the second disapproves it by saying men need guns.

Positive Examples.input:
Sent1: Gun haters will stop when the right to bear arms is banned! 
 Sent2: Gun haters will do any thing to ban the right to bear arms!
Positive Examples.explanation: These two arguments are both discussing gun haters want to ban the right to bear arms.

Negative Examples.input:
Sent1: Gun control will not work because criminals do not obey gun control laws. 
 Sent2: Gun control laws do not stop criminals from getting guns.
Negative Examples.explanation: The answer should be Similar instead since both arguments are discussing gun control law wont work since criminals would not obey it.
